So, you know what, I'm a hacker- if it's looking for this thing in the process, let's try and put it there, so I try to do so in every way I know - and still... nothing, not really sure what my next step is https://t.co/KuhBeE9SjT

Nuxt does some finagling with process.env when it works its magic dividing CSS between the client/server and ends up modifying process.env, which Turf's dependency looks at https://t.co/3Gq5C1HSyL https://t.co/sDHAbGOdST

So I go look up the file, and it's a dependency that turf has on polygon-clipping ‚Äì and the offending line seems simple enough, letting you override a const with an .env variable- sure. But here's where things get a little tricky... https://t.co/AKuuwm96ox

so I'm working in Nuxt 3 and every time I try to include Turf.js (‚ù§Ô∏è‚Äçüî•) I get this cryptic error about POLYGON_CLIPPING_MAX_QUEUE_SIZE, whether I import just specific functions or all of turf https://t.co/JScKQllSZv

@Elijah_Meeks @sharoz @AlbertoCairo The dataviz community is very giving in terms of criticism and feedback, and I am grateful for that. But it is often unsolicited feedback from someone who is not aware of all the constraints/goals of a viz, and some people just like being bar/pie chart police

@Elijah_Meeks @sharoz @AlbertoCairo Remembering being an 18-year-old practicing my first few data visualizations in 2010 and then finding my work (rightfully?) criticized by an established professional for not being a bar chart https://t.co/i9EYDmnF0J
